head.title: Last Year's Winners Back in New York

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Fashion, Beauty and Fitness

hedline.hl1: Last Year's Winners Back in New York

abstract.p: Winners of New York City Marathon last year will be back this year; Joseph Chebet of Kenya and Adriana Fernandez of Mexico will defend their titles on Nov 5 (S)

block.p: The winners of the New York City Marathon last year will be back this year.

Joseph Chebet of Kenya and Adriana Fernandez of Mexico will defend their titles in the race Nov. 5, Allan Steinfeld, president of the New York Road Runners Club and the marathon race director, announced yesterday.
The winners of the New York City Marathon last year will be back this year.

Joseph Chebet of Kenya and Adriana Fernandez of Mexico will defend their titles in the race Nov. 5, Allan Steinfeld, president of the New York Road Runners Club and the marathon race director, announced yesterday.

Last year, the 30-year-old Chebet won the 26.2-mile race by six seconds in a time of 2 hours 9 minutes 14 seconds after finishing second to a countryman, John Kagwe, in 1997 and 1998. Chebet also won the Boston Marathon last year.
Fernandez, 29, was timed in 2:25:06 last year, the second-fastest clocking in the women's division of the New York City Marathon.
